definition: to fall head over heels/(fig.) to come a cropper
to grow/to plant/to insert/to force on sb/to fall head first
heel/to follow closely/to go with/(of a woman) to marry sb/with/compared with/to/towards/and (joining two nouns)
suffix for nouns
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.chinese: 人都有栽跟头的时候，这就是生活。

sentences.english: Dishonest people are bound to come a cropper in the end.
sentences.chinese: 不老实的人到头来总是要栽跟头的。

sentences.english: Good heavens, the impish son is falling this time.
sentences.chinese: 天啊，小鬼子这次是要栽跟头了。

sentences.english: Which economy will be the first to stumble on its problems?
sentences.chinese: 哪个经济体将是头一个在自己的问题上栽跟头的？

sentences.english: He is too clever by half, is that young man; one of these days he'll come a cropper .
sentences.chinese: 这小伙子未免太聪明了一点，总有一天他要栽跟头的。

definition: to fall/fig. to suffer a setback
to meet with unexpected failure (idiom)/to fail miserably (where failure was not expected)
to cost one dearly/to end disastrously/to pay bitterly
lit. the horse loses its front hooves/fig. sudden failure through miscalculation or inattentiveness
to capsize/(fig.) to suffer a setback or defeat
to suffer losses/to come to grief/to lose out/to get the worst of it/to be at a disadvantage/unfortunately
to get smart/to resort to petty tricks
tumble/somersault
so pleased as to lose one's sense of measure/beside oneself with joy
failed and wiped over the floor (idiom); to fail utterly/a crushing defeat/beaten and in a hopeless position
to be taken advantage of
to err/to make a mistake/to do the wrong thing
to go wrong/to take a wrong turning
to make a fool of oneself
to hit a wall/(fig.) to hit a brick wall/to hit a snag/to have the door slammed in one's face
to meet with a rebuff
